intro: Scepseothamnus rotunda, commonly known as the roundleaf thamnus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of central Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the summer months. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with low precipitation. Scepseothamnus rotunda is typically found in rocky soils and is often used in traditional medicine in its native regions.
